meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel awkward or self-conscious.
meanings.sent1: His clumsy dance moves were embarring to watch.
meanings.sent2: She found it embarring to speak in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: It was quite embarring when he tripped over his own feet.
meanings.sent4: The silence after his joke fell flat was embarring for everyone.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected question left her feeling embarringly unprepared.

meanings.sent1: The heavy traffic embarring their journey to the airport.
meanings.sent2: The lack of resources embarring the completion of the project.
meanings.sent3: The sudden rainstorm embarring their outdoor picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: The technical difficulties embarring the live broadcast.
meanings.sent5: The miscommunication between teams embarring the workflow.

meanings.definition: To enclose or surround with a barrier.
meanings.sent1: The high walls embarring the ancient castle.
meanings.sent2: The fence embarring the property from trespassers.
meanings.sent3: The dense forest embarring the path forward.
meanings.sent4: The security measures embarring unauthorized access.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog embarring visibility on the road.
